title: Baroness Kidron accuses the Government of using child abuse as an excuse for encryption
text:
A leading child safety campaigner says the Government is using “the shield and sympathy” of child sexual abuse as an excuse to access encrypted messages.

Baroness Kidron, the chair of the 5Rights Foundation, said it is intentionally “conflating the issues” to open a “backdoor” into private communications. The Government wants tech to let it access encrypted messages and claims encryption helps cyber criminals.

A statement from the Five Eyes alliance of the UK, US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand last year said they “encourage information and communications technology service providers to voluntarily establish lawful access solutions to their products”.

Two staff at the National Cyber Security Centre, part of GCHQ, suggested messaging firms add security services as a “ghost” recipient of encrypted messages. But firms including Apple, Microsoft and WhatsApp said the proposal could “threaten fundamental human rights”.

Lady Kidron has urged firms to implement PhotoDNA, a service developed by Microsoft in 2009 that can automatically remove images of child sexual abuse.
description: A leading child safety campaigner says the Government is using “the shield and sympathy” of child sexual abuse as an excuse to access encrypted messages.
